title: GENIUS Act Signed Into Law, Drives $4B Stablecoin Supply Surge
summary: President Trump signed the GENIUS Act on July 18, 2025, establishing the first major US crypto legislation with federal stablecoin regulations requiring full reserves and licensing. The law triggered a $4B stablecoin supply surge within a week, pushing total market cap above $264B as major banks announced stablecoin offerings.

title: Citadel Securities Opposes Tokenized Equities Regulatory Exemptions
summary: Citadel Securities formally urged the SEC to reject regulatory exemptions for tokenized equities, arguing they should follow traditional stock rules to prevent regulatory arbitrage. The Wall Street giant expressed concerns over liquidity fragmentation and investor confusion as firms like Coinbase push for blockchain-based equity trading.

title: FTX to Begin $1.9B Creditor Payouts in September
summary: FTX received court approval to begin distributing $1.9 billion to creditors starting September 30, 2025, as disputed claims are no longer contested. The payout represents a significant milestone in the FTX bankruptcy proceedings and creditor recovery process following the exchange's 2022 collapse.

title: South Korea Orders Firms to Reduce Crypto ETF and Coinbase Exposure
summary: South Korean regulators directed domestic firms to cut exposure to crypto ETFs, Coinbase, and Strategy, reflecting increased regulatory scrutiny of crypto investments. The directive signals South Korea's cautious approach to institutional crypto exposure amid growing global adoption.
